summary: This is a court order from Judge Richard M. Berman scheduling a status conference hearing on August 27, 2019, regarding the proposed dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The order is accompanied by a Victim Notification System letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office informing a victim witness professional of the hearing and providing access information.

connections.description: Judge Berman is presiding over the court proceedings related to the criminal case against defendant Jeffrey Epstein.
Geoffrey Berman, as U.S. Attorney, represents the prosecuting government in the case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Status Conference Hearing
events.description: A court hearing scheduled by Judge Berman to address the proposed nolle prosequi (dismissal) order for the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, following his death. Counsel for the government, the deceased defendant, and victims will be heard.

events.title: Proposed Dismissal Order
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed a nolle prosequi order to the court, seeking dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein after his death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died before judgment was entered in his criminal case, leading the U.S. Attorney to propose dismissal of the indictment.
Judge Richard M. Berman scheduled a hearing to address the proposed dismissal, citing a public informational interest in the process.
The hearing was set for August 27, 2019, and would allow counsel for the government, the deceased defendant, and victims to be heard.
The document is a Victim Notification System communication, indicating ongoing official notifications to victims or potential victims in the case.
The case numbers referenced are 2018R01618 and 19-CR-00490.
